security_audit.summary: Prompt-only skill providing guidance for using uniswap-sdk. Contains no executable code, no file access, no network calls, and no command execution capabilities. Instructions focus on fetching documentation and safely interacting with the Uniswap DeFi protocol.

content.value_statement: This skill guides AI assistants on how to interact with Uniswap protocol for token swaps and price queries. It provides best practices for safe trading, including price verification and small test transactions before large trades.
actual_capabilities: Guide token swap operations on Uniswap
Query token prices and liquidity information
Find optimal swap routes between tokens
Manage trading risk with test transactions
limitations: Requires Python and ape framework installed
Needs ape accounts configured for transactions
Requires tokenlist installed via ape tokens
Does not execute trades directly - provides guidance only

use_cases.description: Query prices and execute token swaps on Uniswap using Python and the Ape framework.

prompt_templates.title: Get token price
prompt_templates.prompt: What is the current price of [TOKEN_A] in terms of [TOKEN_B] on Uniswap? Use the uniswap-sdk to query the price.

prompt_templates.title: Execute swap
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me swap [AMOUNT] [TOKEN_A] for [TOKEN_B] on Uniswap. First show me the expected price and route, then confirm before executing.

prompt_templates.title: Find best route
prompt_templates.prompt: Find the optimal route to swap [TOKEN_A] to [TOKEN_B] considering gas costs and slippage. Use WETH and stablecoins as intermediates if needed.

prompt_templates.title: Set up trading bot
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up a Silverback bot that monitors Uniswap pools and automatically executes trades based on price conditions I specify.

best_practices: Always fetch the latest documentation before writing code for Uniswap interactions
Query prices and confirm with users before executing trades
Test with small amounts first before making large trades
Use liquid intermediate tokens like WETH, USDC, and USDT for efficient routing
anti_patterns: Relying on general Ape knowledge without fetching current documentation
Executing large trades without verifying prices or testing with small amounts
Skipping pair indexing before attempting swaps
Using low-liquidity token pairs for routing without checking depth

faq.question: Which blockchains does this skill support?
faq.answer: The uniswap-sdk supports multiple EVM chains where Uniswap is deployed, including Ethereum mainnet, Polygon, Arbitrum, and Optimism.

faq.question: What are the gas limits for swaps?
faq.answer: Gas limits vary by network and route complexity. The SDK estimates gas, but you should confirm with the user before large trades.

faq.question: How do I integrate with other tools?
faq.answer: Use the uniswap-sdk within Silverback bots for automation, or combine with ape accounting for portfolio tracking.

faq.question: Is my trading data kept private?
faq.answer: This skill only provides guidance. All blockchain transactions are public. Configure your node RPC URLs for privacy.

faq.question: Why is my swap failing?
faq.answer: Common causes: insufficient balance, slippage too low, pair not indexed, or expired deadline. Check logs and adjust parameters.

faq.question: How does this compare to direct contract calls?
faq.answer: The uniswap-sdk handles routing, indexing, and conversions automatically. It's safer and faster than writing raw contract calls.
